Topic: Draw a habitat and the different living things in each
Evidence Statements: The student can illustrate a specific habitat, either on land (e.g., playground, garden, forest) or in water (e.g., pond, stream).
The student can depict different types of plants in the habitat, such as trees, grasses, bushes, or flowering plants.
The student can depict various animals in the habitat, such as lizards, squirrels, ants, fish, or clams.
The student can make comparisons in their drawing by showing different habitats and the diversity of plant and animal life in each.
The student can demonstrate patterns by showing similar and different types of living things in each habitat.
The student can organize their drawing to clearly show the relationship and arrangement of living things in the habitat.
